intro: Dracaena alexandrae, commonly known as the Alexandra dracaena, is a species of flowering plant in the Asparagaceae family. It is native to the island of Socotra, Yemen, and is characterized by its striking, sword-shaped leaves that are typically blue-green in color. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that appear in clusters during the growing season. Dracaena alexandrae is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-draining soil with moderate sunlight. Its unique appearance and resilience make it a popular choice for indoor gardening and conservation efforts.
